nodes.bodyText:
@srnagar Was wondering if something like this could work, where we convert the long value to OffsetDateTime in the getter only?
As we still need the JsonProperty to be a long value for serializing to expirationDateTimeTicks here
This is an autogenerated class. It shouldn't be modified.

From discussion offline, it seems like this is not an autogenerate class. Fix the license header for this file.
Converting long to UTC OffsetDateTime type is fine but it should be done in the constructor once insted of doing it every time this method is called. Also, fix the javadoc for this method.

Since this is now unmodifiableList , we may want to document this in java doc for its getter @

  
    
      azure-sdk-for-java/sdk/formrecognizer/azure-ai-formrecognizer/src/main/java/com/azure/ai/formrecognizer/models/BoundingBox.java
    
    
         Line 41
      in
      44f6e0b
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public List<Point> getPoints() {
Would it make sense to use !CoreUtils.isNullOrEmpty(errorInformationList) , that will also check for null ?
Don't need to create a new ArrayList here.
Same here - don't have to create a new ArrayList. Do the same in all other places too.

I would use change instead of fix
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,13 +2,14 @@
 
 ## 1.0.0-beta.4 (Unreleased)
 ### Breaking Changes
+- Fix `CopyAuthorization.getExpiresOn()` to return a `OffsetDateTime` instead of a `long` value

nodes.bodyText: maybe remove the last part for the comment as it is now a date and not the seconds?
unmodifiable is more of a Java keyword to help understand what we do underneath.
what is ExtractedField? It seems like old naming we had
